summary: This is an FBI 302 report documenting the interview of a corrections officer (OFFICER 1) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in his cell. The officer describes his shift, the cell counts, and his interactions with Epstein. The interview ends when the officer requests a lawyer after being shown a picture of an unidentified individual.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Inmate found unresponsive in his cell
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The officer states he once fed him, that Epstein was grateful, did not appear dangerous, and never offered him money.

persons.name: OFFICER 1
persons.context: The primary interviewee who was working the overnight shift in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) when Epstein was found dead. He describes the cell count procedures and his limited interactions with Epstein.

persons.name: OFFICER 2
persons.context: Assisted OFFICER 1 with the 12am inmate count and later checked on him during the shift.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: Assisted OFFICER 1 with the 3am and 5am inmate counts in the SHU.

persons.name: THOMAS
persons.context: Relieved OFFICER 1 at some point during his shift to give him a break.

connections.description: OFFICER 1 was the corrections officer responsible for Epstein's unit and once fed him when he had not received a meal.
Worked together conducting the 12am inmate count. OFFICER 2 later checked on OFFICER 1 during the shift.
Assisted OFFICER 1 with the 3am and 5am inmate counts because OFFICER 1 was alone in the unit.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found dead in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC's Special Housing Unit (SHU). The exact date is inferred as the 'previous Saturday' from the interview date of 08/16/2019.

events.title: FBI interview of Corrections Officer
events.description: FBI, TFO, and OIG agents interview OFFICER 1 regarding the circumstances of Epstein's death. The officer requests a lawyer after being shown a picture, and his cell phone is seized via search warrant.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: OFFICER 1 was the sole officer in the locked-down Special Housing Unit (10 South) during the overnight shift when Jeffrey Epstein was found dead.
The officer emphasized that inmate counts require two officers and that officers should 'see breathing flesh,' implying a failure in protocol may have occurred.
OFFICER 1 stated Epstein 'was supposed to be watched more closely' and that rounds should have been conducted regardless of his prior suicide watch status.
The interview was terminated when OFFICER 1 requested a lawyer after being shown a picture of an unidentified individual.
The FBI seized OFFICER 1's cell phone pursuant to a search warrant, but he refused to provide the passcode.
